Nitazenes constitute a class of synthetic opioids developed initially in the 1950s. Their analgesic strength can far exceed that of fentanyl—some analogues are estimated to be 10 to over 40 times more potent than fentanyl and up to 50× more respiratory depressant than morphine(Wikipedia).

HESPERIA – San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department announced that a deputy was arrested on August 5 for extortion and soliciting a bribe. Cameron Romo, 27, of Rialto, was placed on compulsory leave and arrested by the Specialized Investigations Division on a warrant.

Meet The Little 8-Pound Shih Tzu Mix Who is Looking For Love
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Cheddar Biscuit, a little Shih Tzu mix who is searching for his forever home. Not much information was given on Cheddar’s life before coming into rescue care, besides the fact that he comes from down South in Mississippi. Once he came into Great Dog Rescue New England’s care, Cheddar Biscuit was placed with a loving foster family, where he can wait in safety and comfort until the day comes when he meets his new forever family.

Parents of missing 7-month-old Emmanuel Haro arrested for murder
UPDATE: The San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department released a statement on the arrest of Jake and Rebecca Haro in the disappearance of their 7-month-old son Emmanuel Haro. “This investigation began on August 14, 2025, as a reported kidnapping at the Big 5 in Yucaipa. The San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department immediately dedicated all available resources to locate seven-month-old Emmanuel Haro. During the investigation thus far, numerous interviews have been conducted, search warrants have been served, digital and electronic evidence has been collected and closely analyzed. Based on the evidence, investigators determined a kidnapping in Yucaipa did not occur. It is believed Emmanuel is deceased and the search to recover his remains is ongoing,” according to the advisory.

Meet The Sweet Little 10lb Dog Searching For Love
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Mallory, a sweet little mix pup seeking her forever home. While Mallory’s origins remain shrouded in mystery, her Petfinder profile indicates that at some point she found herself living at a shelter. “This sweet & silky girl was rescued from a local shelter in Georgia,” GDRNE states. Since coming into Great Dog Rescue New England’s care, Mallory has been transferred to a loving foster home where she will remain until the day comes when she meets her new forever family, and her life can truly begin.

Luggage and Baggage Rules for Taking a Cruise (How Much Can I Bring?)

Meet The Papillon Mix Searching For New Home After Owners Can No Longer Care For Her
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Bella Butterfly, a 6-year-old mix girl seeking her forever home after an unfortunate life change. Until recently, Bella was living in a home with a family of her very own. However, according to the rescue, “She was surrendered to us in Mississippi by a family who could no longer care for her.” Now living with a loving foster family, “This sweet girl is ready to find a new family to call her own!”

The HUGE Differences Between a $1,000 Cruise and a $10,000 Cruise
What’s the difference between spending $1,000 on a cruise and $10,000 on a cruise? In many ways the experience can be like night and day. The cool thing about cruising is that it’s open to everyone. You want to sail cheap? You can, for as little as a few hundred bucks. But if you want to go big, cruise lines will offer you every chance possible to spend as much as you want.

Dianna Carney
Loyal & Loving Puppy Found Living Alone as a Stray Now Looking For Love
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, recently introduced a 9-month-old Shepherd mix named Newbie who is patiently waiting for her forever family to find her. Found living as a stray in Mississippi, this 30-pound bundle of joy was brought into the New England-based rescue's care and then swiftly placed with a loving foster family. The rescue reports that, where once she was living on the streets alone and hungry, now she is “happy, healthy, and ready to find her forever family!”
 · user · 34.5K followers
Dianna Carney
This Injured Mother Dog Was Found as a Stray But Kept Her Puppies Healthy
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Frannie Fabulous, a young Boxer mix girl who came into rescue care under very difficult circumstances. When Frannie was originally found, she was living as a stray along with her two puppies. While in the difficult position of raising two babies while also trying to find enough food to survive each day, Frannie was injured when rescuers found her. “We are so happy we found them when we did because Miss Frannie also had an injured hip and leg on her left side.” Despite the pain she was in, Frannie managed to keep both her babies well-fed and healthy during their time on the streets.
 · user · 34.5K followers
Dianna Carney
Bonded Pair of Dogs Searching For New Home After "Devastated" Owner Forced to Surrender
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Cowboy and Ladybug, a pair of inseparable littermates looking for their forever home together after an unexpected life change. According to GDRNE, these two siblings come with a heartbreaking backstory. "They were surrendered to us by their previous owner, who loved them fiercely and has had them since the day they were born," reports the rescue. "Their previous owner was completely devastated to give them up, but a change in her living situation offered no other option." Cowboy and Ladybug have been declared a bonded pair and will need to be adopted together by any potential new owners.
 · user · 5.8K followers
Jim DeLillo
Wisconsin Faces a Silent Menace: The Ancient Poison That Killed Socrates Is Creeping into Wisconsin
AI was utilized for research, writing, citation management, and editing. The author has no affiliation with any companies mentioned. The toxic plant that claimed the life of Socrates is quietly spreading across Wisconsin—an invasive force lurking along ditches, disturbed soils, and roadsides. Conium maculatum—better known as poison hemlock—now shows a "presently uncommon" but growing presence in the state, with confirmed records in eight counties and twelve known sites (Wisconsin Watch, Wisconsin DNR).
 · user · 34.5K followers
Dianna Carney
Young Puppy Who Was Thrown Out of Car Now Searching For Love
Great Dog Rescue New England (GDRNE), a dedicated foster-based dog rescue in Massachusetts, would like you to meet Bandit Reynolds, a loving 4.5-month-old Australian Shepherd mix who is seeking her forever home after a difficult start in life. Discovered as an abandoned stray in Tennessee, Bandit's rescue story is particularly heartbreaking. "She was thrown out of a car if you can even believe that!!" shares a GDRNE representative, highlighting the resilience this young pup has already demonstrated in her short life. Now living locally with a foster, Bandit is learning what human kindness and protection mean while she waits for her life to truly begin.
 · user · 6.2K followers
Kateable
The Natural Toilet Bombs That Made Me Ditch Bleach for Good
I used to be the mom who dumped bleach into the toilet without a second thought. I didn’t love it—I just didn’t know there was another option that actually worked. I thought strong smells and burning eyes were just part of a "deep clean." But then I started making my own toilet cleaning bombs—and I haven’t used bleach since.
